name: Source/API.js
SketchAPIWithCapturedContext
description:
Return a function that captures the context.
When called, this function will initialise the API
and return an Application object that provides access
to all API functions.

We do it like this to defer having to perform a lot
of setup until context.api() is actually called -- thus
scripts which don't call it at all suffer minimal overhead.

name: Source/Application.js
Application
description:
Gives you access to Sketch, and provides access to:
- the document model and the layer tree
- metadata abound sketch itself
- utilities for interacting with the user
- access to the running plugin, it's resources and settings

name: api_version
description: The version of this API.

name: context
description:
The context that the API was created in.
This is the traditional context argument that is
passed to all plugin scripts when they are run.

In general you should use the API to access Sketch
rather than interacting with the context directly.

name: version
description: The version of Sketch that is running.

return.description: The version as a string, eg "3.6".

name: build
description: The exact build of Sketch that is running.

return.description: The build number as a string, eg "15352".

name: settingForKey
description: Returns the full version of Sketch that is running

params.name: key
params.description: The setting to look up.

return.description:
The setting value.

This is equivalent to reading a setting for the currently
running version of Sketch using the `defaults` command line tool,
eg: defaults read com.bohemiancoding.sketch3 <key>

name: setSettingForKey
description: Set the value of a global setting for a given key.

params.name: key
params.description: The setting to set.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value to set it to.

This is equivalent to writing a setting for the currently
running version of Sketch using the `defaults` command line tool,
eg: defaults write com.bohemiancoding.sketch3 <key> <value>

name: resourceNamed
description:
Return a file URL pointing to a named resource in the plugin's Resources/
folder.

params.name: name
params.description: The resource file name, including any file extension.

return.description: The resource location, in the form "file://path/to/resource".

name: getStringFromUser
description:
Shows a simple input sheet which displays a message, and asks for a single string
input.

params.name: msg
params.description: The prompt message to show.

params.name: initial
params.description: The initial value of the input string.

return.description: The string that the user input.

name: getSelectionFromUser
description:
Shows an input sheet which displays a popup with a series of options,
from which the user is asked to choose.

params.name: msg
params.description: The prompt message to show.

params.name: items
params.description: A list of option items.

params.name: selectedItemIndex
params.description: The index of the item to select initially.

return.description:
An array with two items: [responseCode, selection].

The result consists of a response code and a selection. The code will be
one of NSAlertFirstButtonReturn or NSAlertSecondButtonReturn.
The selection will be the integer index of the selected item.

name: log
description: Output a message to the log console.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to output.

name: assert
description:
Assert that a given condition is true.
If the condition is false, throws an exception.

params.name: condition
params.description: An expression that is expected to evaluate to true if everything is ok.

name: selectedDocument
description:
The selected document.

If the user invoked the script explicitly (for example by selecting a menu item),
this will be the document that they were working in at the time - ie the frontmost one.
If the script was invoked as an action handler, this will be the document that the action
occurred in.

name: newDocument
description: Create a new document and bring it to the front.

name: message
description:
Show a small, temporary, message to the user.
The message appears at the bottom of the selected document,
and is visible for a short period of time. It should consist of a single
line of text.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to show.

name: alert
description: Show an alert with a custom title and message.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the alert.

params.name: message
params.description:
The text of the message.

The alert is modal, so it will stay around until the user dismisses it
by pressing the OK button.

name: rectangle
description: Return a new Rectangle object for a given x,y, width and height.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle.

name: Source/Artboard.js
Artboard
description: Represents a Sketch artboard.

name: constructor
description: Make a new artboard.

params.name: artboard
params.description: The underlying MSArtboardGroup model object from Sketch.

params.name: document
params.description: The document that the artboard belongs to.

name: isArtboard
description:
Is this an artboard?

All Layer objects respond to this method, but only Artboard objects return true.

return.description: true for instances of Artboard, false for any other layer type.
